FuncDef:
The dhcp snooping alarm threshold command sets the alarm threshold for the number of DHCP messages discarded by DHCP snooping.
The undo dhcp snooping alarm threshold command restores the default alarm threshold. The dhcp snooping alarm threshold command sets the alarm threshold for the number of DHCP messages discarded by DHCP snooping. The undo dhcp snooping alarm threshold command restores the default alarm threshold. By default, the global alarm threshold for the number of messages discarded by DHCP snooping is 100.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the alarm threshold for the number of DHCP messages discarded by DHCP snooping.
The value is an integer in the range from 1 to 1000. The default value is 100.

ExtraInfo: After the alarm function for discarded DHCP messages is enabled, you can run the dhcp snooping alarm threshold command to set the alarm threshold for the number of discarded DHCP messages.
